lore: Some believe that Cockatrices were born when reptiles or amphibians incubated the eggs of other birds, but the truth is these are greatly adaptable birds who very quickly evolved from a common ancestor.\n\nCarrion Cockatrices live in arid environments inhabited by large creatures. These Cockatrices have long stopped hunting, and now simply wait for one beast to devour another, and eat what is left.
menagerieDialog: (It seems incredibly tired - something you never thought possible given its normally-obnoxious personality.)
(What a ridiculous looking, yet endearing creature.)
(Its eyes are crossed. Perhaps this is its strange way of meditating.)
(It's preening its feathers, pulling out all manner of disgusting-looking parasites.)
(This particular Cockatrice seems to be a cut above the rest. Though it may appear to be stupid, you can't help but sense its immense intellect.)
name: Carrion Cockatrice
